channel.title: Amang the Scots
channel.description:
A documentary series about modern Scotland.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: How do the Scots really talk?, part 2
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, explores variations of Scottish speech and language, old and new.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century

item.title: Music of the people
item.description: Introduction to Scottish folk music, with lecture by Norman Buchan, member of Parliament, and includes recordings by Jeannie Robertson and several popular folk singing groups.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century

item.title: Scotland image
item.description: This program explores common misconceptions of Scotland. Includes recordings of Harry Lauder and the high school girls choir, Ayr, in traditional Scottish songs.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century

item.title: How do the Scots really talk?, part 1
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, explores variations of Scottish speech and language, old and new.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century

item.title: More about education
item.description: This program continues to discuss the state of education in Scotland. It features an interview with Dr. Stewart MacIntosh, director of education of the Glasgow City Schools.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century

item.title: Wee bit of history in song
item.description: This program further explores Scottish folk music and how it tells the story of the country.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century

item.title: Over the sea to Skye
item.description: A visit to the Isle of Skye and some of the folk music associated there. Includes a visit to an old castle. Features songs by the high school girls' choir of Ayr.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century

item.title: The state of welfare
item.description: This program discusses the medical profession and public housing in Scotland.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century

item.title: People and problems
item.description: This program focuses on the people and problems of Scotland. Features music by Kenneth McKellar.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century

item.title: Status of education
item.description: This program discusses the state of education in Scotland. It features an interview with Professor Stanley Nisbitt, Dean of the Faculty of Arts at Glasgow University in Scotland.
item.dc:creator: Ewing, William
item.dc:subject: Scotland--History--20th century
